Ok, hands down, I admit it: the original idea has been provided by grizzled_dwarflord in the old guild's thread related to the epic build "Song of wrath".
The user proposed a Bard 15 / Red Dragon Disciple 10 / Champion of Torm 15, however he replied as follows:
But, in fulfilling a true Song of Wrath, I might approach it from a Bard20/CoT20 angle, or Bard25/CoT15, or perhaps even a Bard23/CoT16/Cleric1. I may be treading on a completely new build here, but when you do the latter, you'll get the following:

Lasting Inspiration
CoT Divine Wrath at 15th level, all Divine Damage
More Feats
Can take Divine Shield/Might
Can make more use of Smiting/Extra Smiting
Take Animal Domain so Bard can Summon Level VII beasties.
Take Healing Domain and make all your Bard Cures Empowered
More Buffs
Better Songs
Undispellable
Better saves

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Aquarius! Not my forte at all, but I seem to recall something from Max's Cleric Guide about not wanting to go above a BAB of 15 pre-epic to best use Cleric stuff. I know this is predominantly a Bard build, but I wonder whether swapping in another level of Bard pre-epic might help in that? You wouldn't be losing a feat either, given that you're currently at CoT 7 pre-epic. Of course, Max's guidance may not apply in an instance such as this, but that's beyond my ken.

Just a couple of other thoughts - and they are only thoughts - if you're taking Power Attack, then maybe losing Toughness and grabbing Cleave somewhere might be worthwhile. Alternatively, while I get why scimitar is a grand choice, if you went short-sword, that would open up the martial proficiency slot to allow Toughness back in.

In Dev Crit terms, loose the other one of the two mentioned above and go for Great Cleave. I think that should do it.

Happy to be wrong, of course...

This looks like it could be a very interesting build, mate!

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
How about snatching DM too by getting a second Cleric level?

Yes, she will be 5% dispellable but who counts?

Making her a Dev-Crit toon is as simple as exchanging (improved) knockdown & toughness plus two great strength's with the desired feats.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
@Stagmeister, Clerics usually want to avoid going over 15 BAB at level 20 so they can take advantage of Divine Power, which would give them the 4th attack at full AB, instead of full - 15. With only 1 (or maybe 2) levels of Cleric, this build will not get Divine Power, and so wants all the BAB he can get.

Power Attack is not only a prerequisite for Cleave, but also for Divine Shield and Divine might, which is why he took it.

I know a lot of people will say I'm just suggesting this one because I'm not a great user of it, but Knockdown seems best to me. Your saves are good - bordering on excellent - and with a +9 vs spells, together with all the bardly buffs and tunes, I reckon you've a decent chance with horrid mages without knocking them on their arses. Myself, I would only take Great Cleave for Dev Crit purposes anyway, and I think your current build would do just fine even without Dev Crit in a Dev Crit environment.

But I've been known to be wrong...

If it was Max, he would plummet that CON all the way down to (8!) if he was to rise his AB even for a point 😋

But that is not me, so i would suggest CON to (12) instead. I think 344 hp's aren't that bad for a Power-Bard.

The other solution is to drop Taunt and his INT down to (12) now that he doesn't have (Improved) knockdown anyway, but that must do it only if this character is intended for solo-play!

You see, Bards can rise their AB to very high levels without the need of Taunt, they instead take it for their parties, so everyone can hit the Bosses more effectively.

Just to demonstrate my point with well-build Bards,

A moderate AB of (40) for other characters, can become...

40 (starting AB) +5 (gmw) +2 (bard song) +5 (curse song) +2 (bull's strength) +2 (war-cry) +2 (scabbard of blessing/ aid+bless potions) +2 (belt of frost-giant +4 strength) = 60 AB!

And that character has almost no equipment... Give him a HoTU blade from Rizolvir & a proper Belt of Giant-Strength for his level and now he has 67 AB.

Why do you choose Bard 23 /CoT 15 when Bard 24/ CoT 14 gives the same amount of feats and makes Bard undispellable?

The DR change from 5/+1 to 10/+2 at CoT lvl 15 is generally worthless in epic levels.
In my opinion indispellability is far better than a +2 situational, short time, once per day bonus in self buffers like the bard or cleric.
